The key points here are the waiter's role as an employee and the boundary of his actions. As a waiter, his job is to serve customers, not to interfere in their personal interactions. Even if his intention was good, he crossed a professional boundary by intervening. 

The girl might feel her privacy was invaded, and the date might have felt the waiter was overstepping. The restaurant's policy probably prohibits employees from getting involved in customers' personal matters.
